column1: Scam artists. Called to get Internet. Lady told me they cover my area. Find out they don't. Customer service representative took a 100 bucks knowing at&t had no coverage in my area! I'm filing fraud charges with mank! YOUR NOT GETTING AWAY WITH THIS!

Be aware of their AT&T promotion. I have been  customer individually for almost 4 years and business customer for way longer. I decided to use their promotion $1000 for trade in. They offered me $1,000 promo trade in for my 13 Pro Max 512 GB for 3 year contract. Today I got message they give me only $350 for the phone in a perfect condition without any scratch (always had screen protector and case on) that I could trade in to Apple Store for $350 without any contract or sell privately for about $650. I consider that to be a real scam and I do not want to be customer any more and want my old phone back. Customer support is useless and they even don’t see yet  that my next bill would be adjusted and I would be paying way more.

My daughter got a phone on payments plus unlimited phone service, 1st month phone bill was $211, 2nd month $86, now in her 3rd month it’s $113, why is this not consistent pricing? They told her the first month would be a little over a $100 well it was 211, her phone bill plus phone payment is supposed to run $86 a month total, not $113 like this month.. Very inconsistent and I would definitely not recommend.. I’m not sure if it’s a problem with all att stores or just the one in Berea Kentucky.. Not pleased, fixing to return phone and go with different carrier

I shipped an ATT Uverse modem from Indiana to Michigan in 2016.  It was reported never shipped. ATT has agreement with UPS not to keep record.  This has affected my credit score for years.  This is corruption.  ATT cannot verify my shipment.

Sign up recently on a family plan and what a mistake. Service is terrible. Have to constantly refresh to open pages, streaming is a spotty and lags way too much. It's not just me, it's the whole family. The supposed VIP number that never has wait time, has a very long wait time. I left good service and was over charged for trash service.
Internet only works in my area from 11pm to 6am. I have the $75 a month max plan. Customer service hangs up on me and all of a sudden “can’t hear you.”

Avoid ATT. They have zero service support. You will only get frustrated with recordings that go around in circle. My account was locked out on weekend and ATT would only answer the phone on business hours Monday -Friday!

worst service ever !! Im in Thailand all my friends either had a ESIM card or their Carrier  gave them either free days or signed them up for a one month international plan at a very good price .AT&T Does neither ! You can NOT get a intl plan you have to pay 12.99 a Day! You can NOT use a SIM card, AT&T  Carrier will not allow it unless your phone is paid off and even then only certain ones .. so I have to pay 190.00 for 2 week vacation. And they said today counted because I called THEM!! would not even credit me for calling them .. They just want you to give more money to them!!I’m a Realtor in Washington and since I switched , I can’t tell you how bad the service is , literally showing a house in the city and No service !! embarrassing to clients  !! switching carriers as soon as I get Back !! Horrible Company!

AT&T customer service is horible. I just wanted to upgrade my internet and 3 hours later it was done. I thought the equipment came in and it wouldn't work, frustrated I cancelled the new service and stayed where  i was.Now I am trying again and I have been passed to 3 reps and 2 hours later still no where. AT&T you need to fix your issues. Im going to verizon ot T mobile, they can't SUCK this bad.Scott H

I called because I’m thinking of switching companies. New plans at new places offer discounts. I have been with AT&T since we had bag phones. The rep actually said, she has t-mobile. They offer good deals

They are doing everything illegally. I cannot even move to other service as they made me to stay with them for 3 years. Made a very big mistake moving from Verizon to AT&T. I wish AT&T go bankrupt soon. They are losing customer confidence. Their billing is most corrupt in the nation. Please don't believe Costco AT&T sales people are any sales and move blindly to AT&T. Tmobile has a better service than AT&T in NJ. Lets all sue AT&T for the illegal business practice they are doing.
It was horrible guy couldn’t understand me and I couldn’t understand him I got charged double my bill cause the auto pay messed up they refuse to fix it I’ll be switching carriers AT&T is trash

I have been a customer of AT&T since 2005 until this year at some point I’m ditching AT&T.  I Simpley went to inquire about the new iPhone 16 because I always trusted AT&T. I thought oh well why not trade in my iPhone 12 Pro in perfect condition and fell for their buying your phone for $800 I I realized I had made a mistake when I started seeing the estimated bill I had been taken and have now lost all of my confidence. The store that I purchased this at was very accommodating and tried to help in every way they could put their hands are tied too ultimately I returned the iPhone 16 and of course, lost my iPhone 12 and feel like I was taken, I’m going to discuss this situation fully with the rest of my family that has my other three lines besides mine and we are going to go a different direction. We have AT&T wireless AT&T everything and they’re losing us as a customers.
AT&T fees are excessive $45 plus $10 they offer you discounts and they never give them. Look for other options that offer better service. I would never recommend to AT&T

Bought a new phone as trade in 17 months ago and discovered that at&t auto pay and the line from old phone was still continuing so was charged since then. They never bothered to discontinue the line when switched to new phone and just let it happen. Place is deceitful and wouldn't even bother to refund hundreds of dollars lost from this and will never use At&t ever again. Would recommend same to not use for others who use them.

unacceptable in everyway $70 a month for complete trash that doesn't work. Too bad they are the only service provider in my area otherwise I'd never use this cancer of a company again, terrible service, terrible latency, overpriced, low speeds. I mean how can you have a company that does everything wrong. I'd rate negative stars if i could

We were quoted $30 a line. The first bill was over $1,000! We were on the phone for 6 hours trying to correct it. Finally it was corrected and we were sent an email, because we had to request it, of what our monthly bill should be. Seven months later we still are not billed correctly. It constantly shift from $500-$800. We then call and spend hours on the phone to get it to $450.00 were it belongs. This company should be out of business.

This people are real thief’s  !  They sent me an email with an offer and their representative told me to wait a few days to take up on the offer ( maybe he didn’t want to do it at that moment) and to call back on Monday to get that taken care of. I spend all day Monday calling ATT and just kept getting transfer from place to place to than be told that the offer had expired  and there was nothing they could do about it. Even tho I missed the offer because their own employee provided me with the wrong information. This company does not look out for the long time costumer all they care about is the money. This will be the last month I spend with them.

AT&T's service has been disappointing for me. I've experienced frequent outages and slow internet speeds that have made it difficult to work from home. Customer support has been challenging to reach, and when I do get through, the solutions offered don't seem to resolve my issues. Overall, I expected better reliability and responsiveness based on their reputation, but my experience has not met those expectations.

I started using AT&T prepaid a few months ago and it is the worst service I have ever used. I have to change. Logging in to pay is so ridiculous due to the switching between code and password and due to pw requirements. They try to force you to pay without signing in. There is no way to see payment history. My own mother can't even call. Customer service is terrible. Now i have to change providers AGAIN because of the issues.
You sending a home protection expert after 4 iPhones, you sent a regular Asurion tech. Bluetooth still not working.I have spent well over 15 hours trying to get this resolved. Feel free to respond.

NO LegsNO CarNO FamilyATT used to be a good place to do business.  I guess it's a direct reflection of this country.  For 6 weeks been begging for a way to return my old internet hardware only to be mistreated again and again.  Only trying to upsell me more service or lies.  Yet it sits with a threat of a $150 fee and sitting on my $35 credit.  On disability $35 is a weeks worth of groceries.  Nobody cares they think it's a joke to be disabled.

Spent an hour on the phone with a technical support rep Jospeh trying to troubleshoot my apple watch cellular plan. After not being able to resolve my issue he gave me the wrong phone number for advanced technical support. Spent a total of 4 hours on the phone with multiple different reps in an attempt to do a simple activation of an apple watch. Most masochistic experience of my life. I was respectful and patient the whole time and had a rep put me in hold purgatory.

I have a landline, high speed internet and Directv. I can't do anything on att.com because no matter what I select, I am immediately redirected to directv. So if I wanted to pay the landline or internet, I can't. I've told them a hundred times for several years, they acknowledge it, but never do anything about it. This company must have the worst web designers and IT people on the planet. I pray that the cost of removing the underground lead cable and pension obligations puts them out of business. They do nothing to maintain infrastructure and their fancy fiber cable is coated in a peanut based material the squirrels just love to chew on. This is hands down the absolute worst American Company. Shameful and overpriced to the extreme for terrible customer service.

My experience with AT&T has been nothing short of a nightmare. It began when they accessed my backyard without permission while I wasn’t home, and during this time, a laptop was stolen. Despite raising concerns, nothing was done about the theft—no compensation, no accountability.Fast forward about a year later, when I attempted to deny AT&T technicians access to the utility pole on my property due to a lack of easement. Instead of handling the matter professionally, the technician refused to leave when asked, and the situation escalated alarmingly: I was threatened with a gun and bullied on my own property.The police were contacted, and a report was filed. However, even after AT&T conducted an "investigation," no meaningful action was taken. Their resolution? Terminating my service. This response felt more like retaliation than a solution.AT&T's handling of these incidents demonstrated an utter lack of accountability, professionalism, and respect for customer safety and property rights. I cannot, in good conscience, recommend this company to anyone.

rude employees who are not helpful in any way, shape, or form. i always make it a mission to be kind to any service employees but the associate in their mount pocono location might be the rudest woman i have ever encountered. i gave her no reason to speak to me in such a condescending tone.
Canceled the cell phone within the 30 day Costco period and is in collections for a 2 month service period. AT@T does not care and it shows

With what was a good company has turned into a horrible one.  Five agents and five issues later, nothing has been resolved.  Having one agent ignore this customers plight and decide to place him back in line, really says it all.  No thank you, onto their competitor.

AT&T/Direct TV- Tried to cancel after my husband passed away and I could not afford it. They continued to charge me and added a third more on my next bill.  Many phone calls to try and correct it.  Then they called me offering me more deals.  Not listening to me and up charging me when I am already struggling.

1 star is too high. when you have a problem with A T and T's service and it is clearly their fault the solution is to say they are correcting the issue but it will result in you getting a higher bill. I thought Verizon was bad but this has gone to a new low. I have NEVER regretted using a service in my life as much as signing up this total rip off of a company.I would rather use smoke signals to communicate than pay them one more dime to get less than what I have paid for. I'm guessing data breaches and over charged accounts for services not rendered is their new norm.I Hope They Go Out Of Business

5G is a SCAM. You’ll be lucky if you even get 3. I’m in the middle of the city and it RARELY loads anything. If you are deciding which service. DO NOT GO WITH AT&T!! They have spent more $ on marketing then actually improving their services. STOP PROMOTING 5G if we don’t get 5G. I have $ to spend so I tried each different plan. The only difference is hotspot/unlimited data into the bundle, but the speeds are STILL THE SAME. They lie and say they’re able to support 5G.

I don't know how they still have customers. AT&T allows their reps to lie to customers. Our bill was astronomically higher than what was promised. We were charged for a phone that was supposed to be free with trade ins. Even with proof of all of this, customer service did nothing.They are perfectly fine with lying, scamming and stealing to get that contract. On top of all of that, the service is a joke. All that money and the phone barely works.I wish I would have read the reviews before taking that leap. Don't make the same mistake. Stay far away.

AT&T has locked my cell phone and refuses to unlock it. Salesmen in-store and customer service failed to disclose to me their policy of requiring service for 6 months until after I purchased service with another carrier but couldn't use it because my phone was locked. This lack of disclosure about the 6-month service requirement has caused me significant distress and financial inconvenience. I meet the requirements listed on their website to unlock it. I requested an unlock but the male tech support refuses, was rude and he yelled at me. The store employees said I will have to purchase another wireless phone. I have a family and have been without cellular service for a week and customer service knew my intention to end prepaid service with AT&T and I've paid for service with another carrier but can't use it. It took hours to reach anyone and I had big problems initially starting service which should have been a red flag.

The promotion I used was to trade in your old phone from another carrier and get the new phones with At&t for free.  I did just that I even had to jump through hoops to send in my old phones.  I am on my 6th bill and still paying for the new phones.  The excuse is they are still processing my return.  I wish I never switched over.  I am now paying  $350 a month for 3 phones and the service sucks as well.

The worst customer service from store managers to call center.  I have been attempting for months to get a billing issue resolved and they will not even allow you to speak with anyone that can help.  They claim that a case is created for a manager to review, however no one ever follows up.  Very disappointing service.

I have been trying to unlock one of my cell phones that I purchased at AT&T. The unlock was entered incorrectly and there is a network lock. I have been waiting over 5 days for this to get fixed only to find out today I will need to get to an at&t store to get a sims card to enter the unlock code. they could have told me that on Monday but waited until now. I have canceled my account with them. And I will be billed a full months service + a cancellation fee. This is a very bad company to do any business with. They are ruthless, unelthical, immoral and shameless. Once they are in your pockets ... it takes a lot of patience to remove their hands! One important piece of advise: never ever take a sales persons information as having any credibilty from at&t or any other provider. They will lie to you and find excuses - I think they provide the staff with a list to use.

I submitted a warranty claim on 11/21/24 for a replacement phone. The phone was shipped and lost during shipping.  I called Asurion again on 11/26/24 to check on the status of the shipment. They told me it was lost and shipped a replacement.  I called back again on 12/3/24 to check on the status of my replacement.  Asurion told me once again that the shipment was lost during shipping.  I finally spoke with a Supervisor who finally got me my replacement device.  However, I learned that I had been charged a $250 deductible on each of the previous replacement shipments.  The Supervisor advised me that I would only be charged the one original deductible and the other two deductibles would be credited to my account.  I get my Nov-Dec bill and it turns out I was still charged the other deductibles.  I call Asurion and they say I have to call AT&T for the refund on the refunds.  I call AT&T and they say I have to call Asurion.  This back-and-forth has been going on since 12/3/24.  I called Asurion and AT&T on 1/8/25 and they said they would issue a refund. It should only take 7 to 10 business days.  I call Asurion on 1/19/25 to check on the status of my refund and they state that AT&T can only issue the refund.  I call AT&T on 1/19//25 and they state I can only get my refund from Asurion.  I tried to speak with a Supervisor for both companies and each one disconnected the calls.  I was billed over $700 on my bill.  AT&T refused to transfer my call to a Supervisor on multiple attempts on 1/19/25.  First attempt I held for 20 minutes and was disconnected.  Second attempt, I was holding for 40 minutes before being disconnected.  On the third attempt, the agent refused to transfer the call to a Supervisor and hung up on me!  Do NOT get a warranty from Asurion and /AT&T.

I cancelled the company's business phone service with ATT April 2024, then saw a bill for a credit of $6k. Instead of receiving a check, I later received another bill for $2k. Turns out, they switched the account number from my old one to a new one, and were paying the bills with the credit that was left over. Now, not only do they not want to refund the credit but they want me to pay $3k. They are claiming that number was tied to our account, but if it was, when I cancelled, why didn't they cancel it as well? Why did they switch the account number from the old phone number to this new phone number. I was speaking to customer service, and when I made that statement, the lady hung up on me or something because she was no longer on the line.

I was lied to be a ATT&T employee at a store when told about a promotion. He said we would not have any additional lines added to the bill, and it would only be a few dollars more a month for new devices (apple watch/ipad that I didn't even want, I went in to upgrade my phones). When I saw my bill and called the store even confirmed he no longer worked there because he did this to other people. Anyway, they debited $500 from my account in additional fees, and my plan went up over $100 a month for lines I don't use. Now I've spent hours on the phone trying to get a refund and cancel the phone lines and they are sending me in circles without correcting anything. I filed a fraud complaint that was denied because the representative helping didn't understand the situation either. Huge waste of money and time. Not mentioning details is one thing, but to lie to my face with no accountability is insane. Very bad business & customer service.

Setting up as a new customer and transferring from another carrier, I selected a plan and ordered a phone. Order was confirmed, $$$ deducted from my bank account (set up auto-pay for additional discount), yet no correspondence received had any information on how to set up a way to access my AT&T account, therefore no way to log in, etc. Numerous emails and jumping through hoops attempting to initiate the Signature Program through my employer, a major university where I’ve worked over 15 years, which discount was denied, I called AT&T customer service and was transferred numerous times, finally landing with the rudest rep I have ever encountered. They insisted I must have set up an account with a passcode  for the order to go through, despite my insistence I did not do so - I only provided my email, phone number, SS#, address, etc., online on their website. I have a MacBook which saves every account and password created and have nothing stored. They continued to berate me when I requested the order be cancelled stating they couldn’t since the account wasn’t active. All the red flags are going off and I will not be doing business with this company after this frustrating experience.

Scam artists. Called to get Internet. Lady told me they cover my area. Find out they don't. Customer service representative took a 100 bucks knowing at&t had no coverage in my area! I'm filing fraud charges with mank! YOUR NOT GETTING AWAY WITH THIS!

Be aware of their AT&T promotion. I have been  customer individually for almost 4 years and business customer for way longer. I decided to use their promotion $1000 for trade in. They offered me $1,000 promo trade in for my 13 Pro Max 512 GB for 3 year contract. Today I got message they give me only $350 for the phone in a perfect condition without any scratch (always had screen protector and case on) that I could trade in to Apple Store for $350 without any contract or sell privately for about $650. I consider that to be a real scam and I do not want to be customer any more and want my old phone back. Customer support is useless and they even don’t see yet  that my next bill would be adjusted and I would be paying way more.

My daughter got a phone on payments plus unlimited phone service, 1st month phone bill was $211, 2nd month $86, now in her 3rd month it’s $113, why is this not consistent pricing? They told her the first month would be a little over a $100 well it was 211, her phone bill plus phone payment is supposed to run $86 a month total, not $113 like this month.. Very inconsistent and I would definitely not recommend.. I’m not sure if it’s a problem with all att stores or just the one in Berea Kentucky.. Not pleased, fixing to return phone and go with different carrier

I shipped an ATT Uverse modem from Indiana to Michigan in 2016.  It was reported never shipped. ATT has agreement with UPS not to keep record.  This has affected my credit score for years.  This is corruption.  ATT cannot verify my shipment.

Sign up recently on a family plan and what a mistake. Service is terrible. Have to constantly refresh to open pages, streaming is a spotty and lags way too much. It's not just me, it's the whole family. The supposed VIP number that never has wait time, has a very long wait time. I left good service and was over charged for trash service.
Internet only works in my area from 11pm to 6am. I have the $75 a month max plan. Customer service hangs up on me and all of a sudden “can’t hear you.”

Avoid ATT. They have zero service support. You will only get frustrated with recordings that go around in circle. My account was locked out on weekend and ATT would only answer the phone on business hours Monday -Friday!

worst service ever !! Im in Thailand all my friends either had a ESIM card or their Carrier  gave them either free days or signed them up for a one month international plan at a very good price .AT&T Does neither ! You can NOT get a intl plan you have to pay 12.99 a Day! You can NOT use a SIM card, AT&T  Carrier will not allow it unless your phone is paid off and even then only certain ones .. so I have to pay 190.00 for 2 week vacation. And they said today counted because I called THEM!! would not even credit me for calling them .. They just want you to give more money to them!!I’m a Realtor in Washington and since I switched , I can’t tell you how bad the service is , literally showing a house in the city and No service !! embarrassing to clients  !! switching carriers as soon as I get Back !! Horrible Company!

AT&T customer service is horible. I just wanted to upgrade my internet and 3 hours later it was done. I thought the equipment came in and it wouldn't work, frustrated I cancelled the new service and stayed where  i was.Now I am trying again and I have been passed to 3 reps and 2 hours later still no where. AT&T you need to fix your issues. Im going to verizon ot T mobile, they can't SUCK this bad.Scott H

I called because I’m thinking of switching companies. New plans at new places offer discounts. I have been with AT&T since we had bag phones. The rep actually said, she has t-mobile. They offer good deals

They are doing everything illegally. I cannot even move to other service as they made me to stay with them for 3 years. Made a very big mistake moving from Verizon to AT&T. I wish AT&T go bankrupt soon. They are losing customer confidence. Their billing is most corrupt in the nation. Please don't believe Costco AT&T sales people are any sales and move blindly to AT&T. Tmobile has a better service than AT&T in NJ. Lets all sue AT&T for the illegal business practice they are doing.
It was horrible guy couldn’t understand me and I couldn’t understand him I got charged double my bill cause the auto pay messed up they refuse to fix it I’ll be switching carriers AT&T is trash

I have been a customer of AT&T since 2005 until this year at some point I’m ditching AT&T.  I Simpley went to inquire about the new iPhone 16 because I always trusted AT&T. I thought oh well why not trade in my iPhone 12 Pro in perfect condition and fell for their buying your phone for $800 I I realized I had made a mistake when I started seeing the estimated bill I had been taken and have now lost all of my confidence. The store that I purchased this at was very accommodating and tried to help in every way they could put their hands are tied too ultimately I returned the iPhone 16 and of course, lost my iPhone 12 and feel like I was taken, I’m going to discuss this situation fully with the rest of my family that has my other three lines besides mine and we are going to go a different direction. We have AT&T wireless AT&T everything and they’re losing us as a customers.
AT&T fees are excessive $45 plus $10 they offer you discounts and they never give them. Look for other options that offer better service. I would never recommend to AT&T

Bought a new phone as trade in 17 months ago and discovered that at&t auto pay and the line from old phone was still continuing so was charged since then. They never bothered to discontinue the line when switched to new phone and just let it happen. Place is deceitful and wouldn't even bother to refund hundreds of dollars lost from this and will never use At&t ever again. Would recommend same to not use for others who use them.

unacceptable in everyway $70 a month for complete trash that doesn't work. Too bad they are the only service provider in my area otherwise I'd never use this cancer of a company again, terrible service, terrible latency, overpriced, low speeds. I mean how can you have a company that does everything wrong. I'd rate negative stars if i could

We were quoted $30 a line. The first bill was over $1,000! We were on the phone for 6 hours trying to correct it. Finally it was corrected and we were sent an email, because we had to request it, of what our monthly bill should be. Seven months later we still are not billed correctly. It constantly shift from $500-$800. We then call and spend hours on the phone to get it to $450.00 were it belongs. This company should be out of business.

This people are real thief’s  !  They sent me an email with an offer and their representative told me to wait a few days to take up on the offer ( maybe he didn’t want to do it at that moment) and to call back on Monday to get that taken care of. I spend all day Monday calling ATT and just kept getting transfer from place to place to than be told that the offer had expired  and there was nothing they could do about it. Even tho I missed the offer because their own employee provided me with the wrong information. This company does not look out for the long time costumer all they care about is the money. This will be the last month I spend with them.

AT&T's service has been disappointing for me. I've experienced frequent outages and slow internet speeds that have made it difficult to work from home. Customer support has been challenging to reach, and when I do get through, the solutions offered don't seem to resolve my issues. Overall, I expected better reliability and responsiveness based on their reputation, but my experience has not met those expectations.

I started using AT&T prepaid a few months ago and it is the worst service I have ever used. I have to change. Logging in to pay is so ridiculous due to the switching between code and password and due to pw requirements. They try to force you to pay without signing in. There is no way to see payment history. My own mother can't even call. Customer service is terrible. Now i have to change providers AGAIN because of the issues.

Went to upgrade my iPad and see about my bill. The lady representative said she saw I was on an old “grandfathered”plan and she could get me on a new plan that would lower my bill and get me a bundle that would get me a rebate Visa card etc etc…..I bought it hook, line, and sinker…..got my iPad, new plan, and took her advice because she was looking out for the customer right? WRONG. My bill ended up increasing by over $50. Representative straight up lied to me about the plan and bill charges…I guess to just get the sales. Anyhow, I have since cancelled my ATT internet and now have ported my number over to a new company. Paid off my $1500 iPad so I could move that service as well to the new company. Money is not the object, it is the principle of what happened and how it was done. So because of a very poor representative, ATT lost a 15+ year customer. if this is the type of people that represent you, I have ZERO interest in ever spending another penny with ATT. Very poor company standards.

Whatever you do, don't use this company! I was late on my bill (my fault) so ATT suspended my service. (I understand) But when I tried to contact them, I was in their official site for two hours trying to pay my bill and restore service. Then they OVERCHARGED me by $100 and now they send me nasty emails saying that I still owe them money!!

If I could give this “service” a .5 star I would. I’ve never had an internet service with an attitude but here we are. I’m not kidding, even trying to do a SINGLE download will slow your shit down tremendously. The prices they charge for this and what you get in return should be federally illegal and punishable by public humiliation for 6 business days straight. Don’t waste your time on this dogshit, it might as well be a god damn scam

AT&T’s Internet and service is horrible.  We have had off and on service since before Christmas and today it’s off again.  According to them it’s a fiber issue and they’ve be working it since December 23.  This is ridiculous and unacceptable AND they decided to give us a $5 credit.  We work from home and this inconvenience is far more than $5 and over multiple days.  I’ve been with AT&T well over 30 years and it has significantly declined over the years.  Their service is horrible and unreliable.  I’ll be looking into another service today.

They told me my on the would be 70$ on the 8th of January smh come to find out they charged me 125$ instead of the 70 and said it was due on the 2nd well after they read the agreements too me, these people are scammers  DO NOT DO business with them . You never reach anyone from customer service , it’s always atleast an hour most like because of more complaints that they’re receiving , terrible company .

BEWARE of AT&T bait and switch tactics are becoming infamous for if you read on Google. I have twice now been bait and switched on two different promos. I’m a long-term 15 year customer with multiple lines. i’ve noticed there’s recent lawsuits on this bait and switch tactic also recently so I guess I’m not the only one who’s experiencing this. One was an advertise special in an AT&T store for $20 for an additional line which they didn’t honor and ended up after I went to the BBB speaking with their so-called office of the president. What a joke to resolve their reason for not honoring it the store shouldn’t have been advertising the promo. It was not going on, but yet they take no accountability. Number two promo was upgrade your iPhone with trade-in, my spouse and I did this. They honored mine and not my spouses continuing to charge him full price every month, not giving him the credit that he was supposed to get for his turned in device. I have fought with them over this for over a year through the BBB and the so-called office of the president again it’s a joke this office of the president reps have lied to me each time I talk to them about the resolution there never was a resolution, and they lie in states there were. any problems with your AT&T bill can never be handled with customer service at AT&T because every employee is not educated and tells you a different story and tells you they can’t handle it. You then have to go to the BBB who is very good about submitting the complaint with them and AT&T contact you back right away through the so-called office of the president which totally lies to you and tells you they’ll resolve it. It has been a nightmare for over a year and a half and they have cost me thousands of dollars taking advantage of hard-working people who only take advantage of the promo. and then our bait and switched this should be illegal and they have no accountability. Reminds me a lot of the old Gym memberships when the Gym made it very difficult to cancel, time consuming, and there was a fee. GOOD NEWS this inspired me to quit overpaying for services, $110 mo for 2 lines (w/discounts) changed to $30 a month same features. Perspective- Annual savings $960, over a decade $10,000.

In August of this year, I visited an AT&T store in Grand Junction, CO, to set up four new lines. While assisting me, the representative suggested I also consider switching my home internet to AT&T’s new 5G Wireless service, claiming it would be just as good as my current provider. I was assured that I could try the service risk-free for a week, and if I wasn’t satisfied, I could return the equipment without being charged.Shortly after receiving the equipment in the mail, I installed it and ran a speed test to compare it to my existing internet. The results were disappointing—the speed was not even half of what I was currently getting. I immediately packed up the AT&T equipment and sent it back the next day.Since my bill was on autopay, I assumed that returning the equipment would resolve everything. However, I later discovered that AT&T continued to charge me monthly even though they received the equipment—something a representative confirmed on the phone today (12/16/2024). When I asked for a refund, they told me I needed to have officially canceled the service either by phone or through the website, in addition to returning the equipment.To make matters worse, they claimed they could only issue a refund if I provided the UPS return receipt, despite already confirming they had received the equipment. They insisted this was company policy and that nothing could be done without it.This entire situation has been incredibly frustrating. I expected better customer service and accountability from AT&T. As a result, I’m taking my business elsewhere, and I hope AT&T reconsiders policies like this that only serve to drive customers away.

Our experience with AT&T has been extremely disappointing. On two occasions, they have proven to be an untrustworthy company that disregards their customers. Here’s what happened:We traded in our iPhones and shipped them as instructed. The shipment was received by AT&T’s warehouse, but they claimed they only received one iPhone, even though our shipment clearly showed the correct weight. Despite being loyal AT&T customers for five years, they refused to give us the trade-in credit for the new iPhones and made us pay out of pocket.This has happened to us twice when trading in phones. Each time, they essentially stole our money. We called multiple managers, and one initially acknowledged the issue and applied the credit to our account. However, a higher-level manager later removed the credit, blocked our phone, and restricted our account. When we called to address the issue, we were told that a manager had removed the credit and blocked us.This behavior is unacceptable. If someone in their warehouse stole our phone or mishandled our trade-in, it is not the customer’s fault. Instead, they falsely accused us of not shipping the item. This shows a complete lack of professionalism and integrity.AT&T’s poor handling of this situation, combined with their employees’ and managers’ unprofessional behavior, is unacceptable. We will be sharing our story widely, and many of our friends have already decided to leave AT&T because of this. They are a bad company with unethical practices, and we cannot recommend them to anyone.

I have tried over 5 times to recover money owed to me by AT&T.   I switched to AT&T over a year ago as I was told that I would have 5G and an excellent signal.  That turned out to be FALSE!   So I called up AT&T and asked for a solution.  They said that could send me a signal booster.  It marginally fixed the issues.    However, what they did NOT tell me was this booster was considered another device on my account and charged me for over 6-8 months.  I also discovered that they had fraudulently opened up additional lines, so had a total of 5 (devices) aka lines when I should have only had ONE!!    So I called up AT&T again and here’s where things get really bad.   The customer service and they way have been treated is beyond egregious.   It took me two to three attempts to get those lines closed and credited back.    Now I have made 5 attempts to get that money returned to my checking account.    I was then told that the money was being credited back but it had to be 2 deposits due to a $500.00 limit on return credits.  I said that was fine.  Total was around $700.00.    Well guess what happened next!!   The Money did not get refunded.   I have now tried 4 more times to get that money returned.   Each time I have to explain the whole situation and each rep has to do all new investigations!!   I have now made several more attempts and have been told that I would receive calls back from supervisors on 4 occasions now and not a single person has called me back!   I am UNABLE to retrieve my money for these additional unauthorized lines and I am beyond angry.   I will be consulting with an attorney and filing a lawsuit against AT&T.    Not to mention I will be closing my account and NEVER doing business with their Mobility division ever again!!!!

Rep's deception to obtain account.My husband and I wanted to add Blinq cameras to an empty rental property out of state. We called AT&T and inquired about their service since we already have internet, tv and mobile services at our home. The rep tried several times to upsell throughout the lengthy sales pitch. My husband continued to tell him the ONLY thing we wanted was basic internet until a renter took over the location. The property previously had an Xfinity box outside and I mentioned we should call them and others before deciding. The rep, from another country, disregarded his singular request and aggressively continued upselling tv, etc. In the end, my husband said that he needed the internet asap and could we just go to a local AT&T to pick up the box. The rep said it would need to be shipped and we were insistent that it needed to arrive the next day or we would hold off setting up the account and look elsewhere. There had been squatters and we needed the service asap, even if we had to pay a shipping fee. The rep said it would arrive in a 1 or 2 days and I (wife) said we would decline bc we needed it for security seeing we were returning home and wanted to oversee from a distance. He continued to talk with my husband and said he could get it there in 1 day. I overheard the statement and stated he'd just said it would take 1-2 days and that if he couldn't be certain it would arrive the next day, once again we would pass. The rep placed us on brief hold, then immediately returned to the phone stating that it would be 1 day as he'd gotten "permission" from his supervisor. All said and done, it didn't come the next day, nor the next, as we purposely waited hoping it would arrive and then headed home disappointed. It took 4 days and we had to reroute delivery to a UPS location.Upset at the blatant delivery lie, we called back to get further info on service and the rep who misrepresented the service. The new rep, another from outside the US, said that she couldn't see who took the order. She added that was standard for delivery to take 3-4 days and apologized that he said 1-2 days as he knew that wasn't the case. I wanted to include his first name or number here so AT&T could address it specifically as this level of service besmirches their brand.There seems to be no accountability anymore and frankly people just don't care. Well, I do, and standing behind your word is everything. Again, the level of professionalism and customer service is lacking and very disappointing. I will be looking to move my service, from the rental location and my personal home soon.

WARNING !!!! STAY AWAY!!!! Literally two of the worst managers I've encountered in less than 8 days. I would not come to this location as they have a new manager named Garrett. Garrett without my consent took in my trade that I told him. I wanted to get a refund on because a previous sales person by the name of Zachery sold me new iphone and plan telling me I could combine the new number to my main phone line. This would allow me to have a new phone and not have to pay off the other phone. All I would have to do is pay the taxes on the new phone.I technically have 14 days to return my new phone and 30 days to trade in my new phone. However when I went in today trade in my phone I was told I still had to pay the balance on my old phone. I explained the situation to Garrett and all Garrett did was look down at his eyepad not once looked me in the eyes while explaining that Zachery made a misstep. I then told Garrett I would like a refund and keep my old phone and return the new one and remove the additional phone line since I was tricked into buying the new phone.Well Garrett did not tell me while he was on his iPad that instead of processing the refund and return he actually processed the trade in without my formal or signed concern. Garrett basically said he could no longer process a refund because he processed the trade in. Garrett then tossed the receipt on the table and walked away. Not only was that rude it was a fraudulent transaction since I did not consent to trading in my phone. I am surprised AT&T would allow Garrett to be a manager and conduct shady business while having a new hire and existing staff near by. Garrett lacks integrity, leadership, decision making skills. Processing my trade in without my consent and not refusing to refund me my money and give back my old phone is absolutely unacceptable since I am well in my rights to do so.This AT&T location is an Authorized Retailer not an actual AT&T store. That means that these kind of issues are dealt with at the Authorized Retailer level and corporate AT&T does not get involved. So basically you get ripped off.What basically happens is they steal your trade in of $1000 dollars and give you the street value of $350. So now if I return my new phone and cancel my new phone line they will only give me $350 for my old phone versus the $1000 dollars promotional offer I was promised. Why would I want to sell them my phone for $350? When I would have just kept my old phone and been a happy customer. Garretts lack of customer service, communication and honesty was by far the worst I've experienced at any store I've been to. I personally would never hire someone with that type of integrity.It's no wonder Zachery was let go and they have such a high turnover rate. That is two managers I've dealt with in less than a month. Now Garrett is the new manager and that's even worse than Zachery. This location will steal from you like they did from me and I would highly recommend you go to an Actual AT&T store or buy online from AT&T. These Authorized Retailers are shady and especially this location. Why would you continue to hire managers who steal and mislead their customers.The name of the company that's responsible of the location is Prime Comms - AZ. I am absolutely appalled by the service I received from AT&T, specifically from a representative named Vanardo. My family and I have been loyal customers for over 20 years, with six premium phone lines, and we expected better than this blatant deception.During our call, Vanardo assured us that we were eligible for completely free upgrades on all our phones. He explicitly stated that our monthly bill included a fee for "Anytime Upgrades" and that we had accrued extra credit, making our trades entirely free. Fast forward to now, and I’m trying to ship back our old phones only to discover that there is no shipping label as promised.When I logged into our AT&T account, I was shocked to find that we are being charged full price for the new phones—$38 a month for each of the six phones over 36 months! This is nothing short of a scam. Vanardo's statements were clear, and I demand that AT&T review the recorded call, where all of this misinformation is documented.I spoke with a supervisor (MYLENE) who offered no real help. She claimed she couldn’t access the call transcript but assured me that once they do, the evidence of Vanardo’s promises will be undeniable. It’s infuriating to know that the company I’ve trusted for two decades is engaging in such deceptive practices.AT&T needs to take responsibility for this situation. I expect a full review of this case, a reversal of these charges, and a proper resolution. This is unacceptable, and I will not stand for being misled by your representatives. If AT&T does not take liability for this situation, I will be forced to take my business elsewhere after 20 years.

AT&T is the absolute WORST!!! My father in law passed away right after Christmas time in 2023. Unfortunately, right before his passing his cellphone was stolen. We have since been going through probate which has been smooth except for AT&T. Do not ever buy anything from them. First off, they require you to have a PIN. If you do not have this PIN, you cannot gain access to any information. When we first tried to contact AT&T regarding my father in law's passing, we were asked for a PIN. Well, I know this is hard to understand but my father in law is dead and cannot give us his PIN. We guessed every amount of relevant numbers we could thing of and none of them worked. Mind you, we had his social security number, his date of birth, his cremated remains, his mother's death certificate; anything and everything you'd need to resolve these accounts. Instead we were told over and over again that they would send a link to reset his PIN to his stolen phone. It was like a Saturday Night Live sketch where we tried to explain that we didn't have the phone. After almost a year of dealing with them, they have now told us that we need to go into the corporate office to get a letter so that we can give it to our lawyer saying there is no financial responsibility but was told by the staff at the corporate office that without the PIN there is no way to see if there is financial responsibility. So even if we had a check for all the money needed to pay down the account, without the PIN number we would not be able to pay on the account. On another note, one of the employees that works for the corporate office told us that he had the EXACT SAME issue and it took 2 YEARS to resolve!! How is this still an issue with this company?? NEVER BUY ANYTHING FROM AT&T!!

If I could give zero stars, I would.  Alexander Graham Bell would be so ashamed that the company he founded has zero integrity today!!The company changes their operating systems without notifying customers.  And, I strongly believe that this is in an effort to have customers enroll in auto-pay or be charged a service fee for having a customer service rep process the payment.  I, for one, will never enroll in auto-pay with AT&T as I do not trust them!!For years I have paid my internet bill through the automated system.  Then since the last 6 months or more each time I call the system automatically routes me to a live agent. None of the reps with whom I spoke since this started happening was able to explain why this was happening.  Finally, today I got a rep who explained that the system started linking my phone number with an account I had some time ago for phone services (and which I no longer have).  Now, I would have to key in the account number for the internet service.This is not the first time that shady ATT changed their system and created confusion and frustration for customers. For over 10 years I had been paying my bills thru the auto system using a bank account and had never used the 4 zeros with which the account started.  Suddenly last year, the auto system could not recognize my banking info.  Almost a year and several calls later, I was told that I now had to key in the 4 zeros.If the company truly cared about the customers, we would be notified when these changes are made.  Or at least, the customer service reps should be properly trained so that they can resolve these issues for the customers.

On 9/18- I tried to upgrade my Google pixel 6 pro to a Samsung Galaxy 24+ online. I had problems, so I had to contact AT&T via chat. They called me and did the entire transaction including payment. It went easy and I received the phone on 9/23. I did my data transfer and put in my sim card on 9/25, immediately my account was shut down at 6:15pm. I didn't understand what happened, so I had to use another cell phone to contact AT&T. It took 20 mins to get a rep on the line.She went through my acct, saw I owed nothing (I always pay my bills on time) and then asked me if I reported a lost/stolen phone. I told her no. She asked me if I had the Google pixel 6 pro and Samsung 24+ phones in front of me and I told her yes. She said ok, but she couldn't fix my acct she would have to transfer me to technical support. This took 45 mins.Technical support came on the line and started interrogating me. He asked me where I bought the phone, how did I do the transaction, when did I get it. I had to read the EID numbers off each phones and then he put me on hold, then he came back to ask me more questions. At this point I got upset, I told him to review their records since AT&T did the transaction, they sold me the phone, they sent me the phone, they should have everything in their records so stop interrogating me and look everything up. He put me on hold again and eventually came back on the line to tell me, he is sorry- on Sept. 17th; the phone they sent me was reported stolen. However, it was taken back to the store and then sent to me. When I put my sim card in the phone, it shut down my account since now it looked like I stole the phone.I told him, ok how are you going to fix this since I also use my phone for work. This is unacceptable. It took him another 25 mins to get my acct on line, so my sim card could work in my old phone. I had to drop the "stolen phone" to the UPS store so they could receive it(on 9/26).I called them today, 9/30. Another process getting them on the phone. Another issue getting them to recognize that they now have the "stolen phone" which they have now even started to process. The phone is still on my acct. Even though they admit this is completely their fault once again, I can't get a new phone or have anything done for another 7 days. Then, they will give me back my money and I will have to redo the process again myself.Throughout this entire process, all I'm getting is empty apologies. No recourse for their actions. Since they will not send me the phone I actually paid for, they will have to refund my money. They will not re-send me the samsung 24+ phone, because even though they admit they sent me the "stolen phone," on my account it looks like I used a stolen phone; therefore now even once they clear it, they can't do anything.I don't want anything to do with a company that treats customers like criminals, when the company makes a mistake. Once I get my money, I'm going to Verizon or Team Mobile. Just wanted to let the public know. Great customer support AT&T, you really show much you value our time and business.

(Pun intended)  HORRIBLE customer service.  Several minutes to try and wade through an automated answering system which cannot understand you.  And Heaven help you if you don't have a problem that fits neatly into one of their little categories - because at that point, the automated service will say to you "Sorry you're having trouble.. Please try again later.."   And that's it  - You're done.On the occasions when you DO reach an actual human.. they are half a world away, with accents so bad that you cannot understand them, and ending up spending an inordinate amount of time asking them to slow down - WHICH they will confuse with "Speak Up".  At which time you have to remind them that you can Hear them just fine... It's not a volume issue.  It's a diction issue.  And that's when they break into 'script' mode.  They communicate by reading from that script... and CONSTANTLY "thanking you for that information".  And then eventually hanging up on you.I Called the toll free number that was ON MY LAND LINE BILL - spent 30 minutes trying to explain my issue to someone who had zero working knowledge of the language.. only to find out .. .that he was SOMEHOW with the cell phone division.  And so, I got to begin the process all over again.Issues that could be handled in a matter of minutes will often take hours because of this.  AT&T is essentially giving a big middle finger to it's client base, saying .. ."There's not much you can do ..  as WE are a shining monument to what can be accomplished when there is virtually NO Competition."There are over SEVEN THOUSAND negative reviews on Trust Pilot alone - this should be some indication that AT&T isn't about to fix a thing.  I would consider letting AT&T know about my review, as TP suggests.  Why bother... it's clear they don't care.

My husband some how loses his phone and so AT&T states to file an insurance claim. What no one tells you is that if the phone has been used then insurance won't replace it.... I have cancelled their service on 8/5/2024 and have followed their instructions to return the equipments at a UPS store with my account number on 8/6/2024. I am grateful to the UPS staff who reminded me to keep the return receipt for 2 years, as AT&T may try to claim that I did not return the equipment.On 9/8/2024, I received a reminder email from AT&T claim that my AT&T equipments haven’t returned. The day after, I went to the AT&T store and spoke to the staff. They suggested me go back to the UPS store and check with them. Despite providing them with a receipt to proof the equipments were returned, they were unable to check for me as they claimed to not have contact with UPS. After spent over 30 minutes on the phone with them, they assured me everything was taken care of and made a note on my account.After a week - 9/15/2014, I receiving a reminding email again. I did not take any action as I assumed they needed more time to update their system. Unfortunately, I have now been charged a non-return equipment fee of $200. I have attempted to resolve this issue by reaching out through chat, but the virtual agent was not helpful in resolving the issue.This situation is frustrating and time-consuming and could have been easily avoided if AT&T had properly handled the situation. It is unacceptable for a company to charge customers for returned equipment, especially when proof is provided. This not only causes inconvenience for the customer but also wastes their valuable time and resources. It is important for companies to uphold their promises and provide efficient and satisfactory customer service.

I have started receiving alerts from my PPI monitoring services that my PPI was compromised during the AT&T breach upon which the alerts I received actually showed the information that was compromised. I called AT&T customer service upon to simply let them know and ask for the service they were providing to address the leaked PPI.When I spoke to a representative, I was told unless I knew the exact date my information was leaked AT&T's position is to not take responsibility for removing the compromised information from the Dark Web because their investigation revealed SS# were only leaked on specific dates.  I confirmed my understanding with the customer service representative and again asked for clarification that it is the position of AT&T not to take the due diligence to remove the information that was leaked. Again I attempted to explain I am receiving alerts  from my current monitoring services that are showing me what is out there with AT&T being the source.  Obviously. The representative was just following company procedures.  However, he offered no assistance, no customer service, no compassion, or concern for the situation AT&T is responsible for, other than to insist it couldn't be AT&Ts responsibility.  I have had AT&T cellular services for over 20 years. This is the third data breach with the company. Surprisingly, I havent had data breach issues of this severeity from all the other business and platforms I use, but have had three with AT&T.  AT&T is the only data breach that I have had that actually has mishandled my PPI that is vital to my identity verification. The company offered no incentive for their negligence to me. Their customer service was less than helpful, offered no possible course of action, did not have the knowledge/skills/desire to help educate me or even make any considerate attempt to reassure me if I have further troubles with this matter Att will be there to assist me.  Thus, I am responsible for the expense and detriment without so much as a concern from any company representative or the company itself.  My work phone is through another carrier who doesn't seem to have the blatant disregard for providing valued customer service or do they have repeated data breaches that have impacted me. Needless to say, it's been my personal experience there are better options for cellular services providers.

Well, a couple months ago we were having issues with our phones and we took them to the ATT Store in Valpo.  They were awesome.  They fixed her phone and found us some "savings" on our account.  I haven't really seen much of that but that's not the point.  They also convinced us to with to switch to their internet air by offering a considerable discount.  While I wasn't thrilled to switch to internet by air for my home internet, they had a trial period and the discount was substantial enough to make me try it.  Well, the end of the trial came and the service was, in a word, eh, but just as good as what I had so with the promised discount, I determined worth it.  Well, one month went by and the discounted rate was not applied.  Two months, three months, still nothing.  Finally I called to ask where the discounted rate was.  After about 20 minutes, the apologized and stated that the discount did not apply since we were already an ATT internet customer.  I explained and asked why did they think I would switch if the discount didn't apply since I had their service already?  After about 20 minutes I was promised that they would honor the agreement made in store and apply the discount retroactive......Problem solved, right?  Nope.  Two months later still no discount.  I call again.  Same story, no discount since I was a current customer.  Again, I asked why would I have switched then if I wasn't promised a discount.  Surprisingly they had no answer.  This time however, after waiting 30 minutes on hold, I was told that I need to go back to the store and talk to them but they will not be giving me a discount on that service. So basically ATT lied to me twice.  I informed them that I will not be returning to the store.  I will be taking my overpriced wireless accounts and my home internet to another provider so the only contact they will get from me is how to return this egg.  So, the moral of the story.  If you have ATT, be aware they do not care about their customers and if you don't, LOOK ELSEWHERE.  Their service isn't that great and their company is a bunch of liars that will say anything to get you off the phone.  Oh, and I have been on a waiting list for well over a year for Fiber interned and still no closer.  Good thing at this point.
The biggest thieves in this country are ATT and they justify everything, the service is not so good, they are professional thieves

I ordered AT&T Internet Air for business with static IPs, but the device they sent lacked the static IP information I needed. The saleswoman who sold me the service was unhelpful after making the sale, directing me to call the 800 customer support number instead. After making more than 20 calls, I finally found someone who could assist, but they told me to return the device and suggested I call back to cancel the service. After returning the device, I made another 5 more calls before finally reaching the right person to cancel the account. From the time I ordered the service to the time it was canceled, I spent two months, made over 20 calls, wasted more than 10 hours on the phone, and made several trips to AT&T stores. Throughout this ordeal, I was repeatedly transferred to the wrong departments and even hung up on multiple times.AT&T's customer support is chaotic and frustrating. Their representatives are often rude, and the system is disorganized. There are separate departments for residential and business accounts, each offering different services—like phone, TV, fiber internet, U-verse internet, and Internet Air. Each department has its own customer service team, and they can't handle issues outside their specific area. Additionally, AT&T does not provide a clear phone number for specific problems. The general customer service number, 800-331-0500, often leads to dead ends, depending on the representative's knowledge.

Sold at Costco, was told by ATT Retail that the Costco "contractors" were a scam, increased plan cost, botched transfer from Xfinity in the retail store (assigned phone number to an apple watch), other botched transfer issues, cancelled service after 4 days ("buyer's remorse") and in took 25 hours of phone calls (plus one hour waiting for a store manager to leave and go to lunch only to have him tell me to call "Customer Retention") over five months to stop getting billed for services. I was supposed to get almost $800 in credits but only got $540 (approximately) of them processed. Multiple promises that they would provide credits and correspondence.  I think my experience with them is over, after the put me in collections for $38.77 because I told my credit card company to stop paying their bills (after not having their services for several months).  They charge the $38.77 for my autopay being rejected!  I finally paid the $38.77 because it was less "costly" than spending another two hours on hold and with ATT Biling rep tell me that his manager had to call me back withing 48 hours!

I am incredibly disappointed with the abysmal customer service from AT&T Fiber. After being a loyal customer with an account in good standing for years, I encountered a situation where my credit card had to be replaced due to fraudulent activity. This caused a slight delay in payment—completely out of my control. Despite explaining the situation to their customer service, I was hit with a one-time late fee.You would think that after years of reliable payments, AT&T would show some flexibility or basic human understanding. But instead, their customer service was rude, dismissive, and completely unwilling to help. They refused to reverse the fee, even though I explained that the delay was due to a situation involving fraud, something I had no control over.Rather than appreciate a long-time customer or even show empathy for an obvious and honest mistake, AT&T treated me like just another number. The customer service reps were condescending, cold, and seemed more interested in enforcing rigid policies than providing any actual service. This level of treatment is shocking, especially from a company that claims to care about its customers.If AT&T Fiber is willing to treat loyal, long-standing customers this poorly, I can only imagine the experience for everyone else. They clearly value squeezing a few extra dollars over treating people fairly or maintaining customer relationships. Stay far away if you expect any decency or customer care.

AT&T definitely has a customer service issue.  I notified AT&T before I moved out of my apartment to have service cancelled.  They told me at the time that I had to turn in the modem.  I told them at that time, and several times after that, that I didn't have a modem. I told them there was a big built in box with a door in my closet and that the modem must be built in.  I had always lived in a house and knew where my modem was located. I talked to them several times before I moved about the modem, and no one ever told me that the modem was in the box.  I found out from apartment management that there was indeed a modem in the box, but this was after I moved 6 hours away.  I explained the situation to AT&T and asked if someone could pick it up, and they said no.  People are moving in and out of the huge apartment complex all the time and most use AT&T, so someone could have picked the modem up.  Now three months later, they say I owe $150, didn't offer me a way to pay in installments, and turned it over to collections.  One of those times I spoke to them before I moved 6 hrs. away, someone should have told me where the modem was located.  They just don't care!

He also said that he was going to send me a replacement for a phone that I had just recently lost that day earlier. That phone has since been canceled on someone’s end, but not mine. That employee said that I would be basically paying the same amount as I was paying previously, and that there would be no way that my bill would be $268. Calls are dropped and/or broken up constantly even with AT&T representatives on the call. Promised a cell booster by rep and when transferred to technician they said they had no info about it and denied it.-Deceptive and illicit business practices resulting in lost time, increased billing, and unaffordable services-Transfering my current plans to new ones when they want to sell new products, At least 3 new 2 year contracts on accounts recently.-Making arrangements without documenting or sending email confirmation, resulting in the account being suspended and the full bill being due to turn the accounts back on.-And the data breach has leaked my personal information to the dark web.I do not want to continue having these issues with your company. I would expect that this would be handled immediately, as I am limited on my time for reparations. I will also be forwarding this email to The Attorney Generals office and the FTC, along with other agency outlets if this is unattended. After spending far more time than any customer should have trying to figure out why the ‘Blocked Contacts’ feature on my iPhone is ineffective, I was on another 24-minute call with AT&T’s tech support. This was just the latest in many calls and chat sessions that have gone nowhere. The same issue remains unresolved—and it’s been years.I’m talking about an iPhone 11-Pro I purchased directly from an AT&T store just before COVID-19 hit. So, this problem has been festering for quite a while. Let me get straight to the point: I’m done. I refuse to be your unpaid, unappreciated beta tester. I’m done dealing with spam calls slipping through despite being ‘blocked’ by a feature that should be reliable. But why do ALL blocked numbers "slip through"?We’re talking about years of this nonsense—years of you pretending that spammers somehow outsmart your technology. Any competent business would have flagged and fixed this issue by now—either out of respect for their customers or to cut costs. Unless the real goal is to keep customers frustrated, waste time on tech support, and eventually push them toward paid “upgrades.” All the while, small business owners like myself bear the cost of wasted time and lost productivity.I decided to test this myself. Following your instructions, I called my cell phone from one of our business lines and blocked the number. The call went straight to voicemail—no ring, no notification. So why doesn’t it work this way for every other blocked caller? Is it that hard to make this technology consistent? Or is it designed to fail?Given AT&T’s resources, I find it hard to believe you can’t solve this. Especially when offering “upgrades” like AT&T Call Protect, AT&T Mobile Security, and AT&T ActiveArmor—each conveniently priced at $3.99 per line per month. I’m old enough to remember when the federal government broke up AT&T’s monopoly. What I see now feels like déjà vu—the same tactics that got you into trouble. And let me assure you, those tactics won’t work in today’s market.I’ve been a loyal customer since the 1970s. Not because you were the cheapest but because you were supposed to be the most reliable. I’ve paid a premium for that reliability—$115 for the remaining two lines, to be exact. But now? I’m looking at $15 per line elsewhere, with service that’s just as good, if not better. And to top it off, I’m sitting here with one bar of signal, practically within arm’s reach of the state Capitol.After decades of loyalty, I’m finished. I won’t keep paying for what I once believed was trust and reliability when it’s clear those values are no longer upheld. I urge others facing similar issues to reconsider their loyalty to AT&T. It’s time to explore more reliable alternatives.

THEY WILL SCAM YOU!!! DO NOT, I REPEAT DO NOT FOR YOUR OWN FINANCIAL SAFETY EVER USE AT&T. YOU WILL GET SCAMMED.AT&T has been charging my account since October 2022 fraudulently. I moved apartments and cancelled my services with them in October 2022. They then requested I send back the equipment which I did. They continued charging me every month for 2 years and NEVER sent a single notification via email or mail that they were charging me monthly. They kept charging me after I cancelled their services and returned their equipment. Two weeks ago, I discovered they were doing this and called them to be refunded for those backdated months. The employee named Sandro (account manager, in the loyalty department) told us to cancel it again on august 7th 2024 so we would not continue to be charged and said he would open an investigation. He said the investigation takes up to about 7 days to process so to call back then. Upon calling back 8 times since then, I have not had a single representative able to help us move the process along or have any information to give us. Today, I called back again (and was escalated to several managers) and they told us that if we had kept the account open and not cancelled it with Sandro, then right now they would’ve been able to backdate the cancellation so we could have been reimbursed for those months. So an AT&T representative guided us in the complete wrong way and now caused us not to be able to be reimbursed for those charges. Not to mention, AT&T can check the usage and see that we were not using their services at all since October 2022 (when we moved out of our apartment) AND have an email confirmation for returning their equipment. Every representative kept telling us there is no record of a cancellation so we basically are correctly being charged. How can that be possible when I have a confirmation of returning the equipment? Did I just randomly want to return your equipment and continue paying for internet even though I don’t even have your equipment and no longer live there? makes no sense. Then they tried to say the returned equipment could be for a reason unrelated to the cancellation, like maybe an exchange. BUT THEN WHERE IS MY EXCHANGE? There is no exchange. It was for a cancellation. I have been on the phone cumulatively for over 6 hours trying to resolve this issue and no one even cares to help me in a meaningful way. I have been transferred to Loyalty, Customer Service,Billing, even Collection. The worst part is despite all of this headache, numerous phone reps will put me on hold and just never return. I have dealt with this so many times, I’m not sure if this is a tactic to get off the call Scott free when they cannot figure out what to do, but please try to imagine how annoying that would be. Every manager has told me the best they can do is credit my account for 1 month of the back dated charges. How can a company like AT&T have such an abysmal resolution process? I will be sharing this story with as many friends and family members as possible

Complaint: After seeing almost every other company offering plans for what i consider the same level of service for substantially less per month, i reached out to AT&T to see if there was anyway to lower my bill. I figured that with over 20 years of being a loyal customer they would be able to do something, however to my surprise they weren't willing to do anything so i cancelled my service and transferred to Verizon for over 100 dollars less per month. Upon transferring my service i made sure to pay my balance to $0 while i was in store to ensure i was paying whatever the current balances due were paid. Now, i get a call 2 months later saying i still owe almost $300, which is impossible because you can't cancel service AND i also transferred my 2 phone numbers to the new carrier. After speaking with a support manager Alex he kept telling me it was for a past due balance and didn't care to look at the facts (it's not possible to transfer a line or service altogether especially to a competitor if there is a balance due). Alex tried to say that the final payment was reversed to which i told him no it wasn't and would provide my bank statement as proof...then he said "i'm sorry sir that must be a lie." He didn't request for me to send it to AT&T to clear up the discrepancy, no, after 20 years with the company I'm now a liar because I won't let them extort me for another $300 dollars. If i hadn't transferred to a new provider i bet that bill wouldn't have mysteriously appeared. I'll also be filing a complaint with the attorney general as well as posting this exact review on every social media channel i can because this is a horrible company that everyone should stay away from!After being a customer of AT&T for over 20 years there is nothing good to say regarding this company. AT&T could care less about their customers and have made that blatantly clear to me.

Trash. The service was subpar, but nothing to complain about. My wife and I shared a grandfathered data plan with my mom until she died. My mom didn’t write down her AT&T password or passcode, so whether my wife and I were going to stay with AT&T or switch, the only way to do it was to go the local AT&T store to transfer our lines to an account in my name. When I went there, they told me we weren’t allowed to keep the grandfathered data plan and would have to switch to unlimited. My wife and I use very little data, so I knew at that moment we’d have to switch carriers to get a fair price for the service we need. I set up autopay and paperless billing with AT&T before I left the store that day. 3 days later I ported our numbers to another carrier, and 2 days after that I received our final AT&T bill. I didn’t know until I received this bill that AT&T doesn’t prorate final bills. In addition to charging us an entire month for only 3 days of service, they also took away the $10 per line discount we should have received for setting up autopay and paperless because I canceled our service before the bill was generated. I tried multiple times on the phone and in online chat to make my case to customer service that we were unfairly overcharged. Even if I had conceded I was at fault for not knowing they don’t prorate, they at least should have reinstated the autopay discount when I explained our situation and the reason we canceled our service. Every representative I spoke to gave the same answer: there was nothing they could do unless I reactivated our service. Doing so would have made no sense because my wife and I aren’t big data users.I will absolutely never be an AT&T customer again. They showed no mercy to a grieving family and made us pay $160.32 on our way out the door for only 3 days of service on 2 lines.
