I have had a cell phone for about 3 decades, originally with Unicell here in the Mad River Valley of Vermont, and then ATT bought that company. I used to get 3-4 bars of service at my house, and very spotty service or none in the Valley. A few years ago they started charging extra "administrative" fees, as they started rolling out 5G. Then I started getting only 1-2 bars at my house. Last year they increased the cost of my plan (unlimited talk/text + 4 GB data with some rollover) by $5. Last month they notified me that my plan will be going up by another $5. I researched and decided to change to a prepaid plan for $25/month, prepaid for a year. I tried to do that over the phone but after waiting on hold for a while, I was told I would have to call the prepaid phone number. I called that number and it turned out that number was only for dealing with an existing prepaid account. I tried calling the main number again. The wait time was about a half hour so I opted for the callback. Within a half minute of receiving the callback, the call dropped. I waited for another call but none came. I called the number again and this time the wait was about 1 1/2 HOURS. I called a nearby (40 minute drive) ATT store. Matthew said he could set that up but I had to make an appointment. He set that up for yesterday afternoon at 3:30. I arrived a minute early and found Matthew with a family trying to make up their minds, and he was the only employee there. I waited about 15 minutes and I had to not only tell him that I had an appointment but I had to tell him again why I was there. He asked for my driver's license, but I knew from previous experience that store employees demand that and copy it or enter all of that info into their system, even if you only want to buy a charging cable. I only use my passport ID card because it has less personal info to get hacked. After entering all of the info, he asked for the ID again and had to re-enter all info. He told me that I did not need a new SIM, but I showed him on my phone that I did, so he charged me another $5+ tax and installed one. That process took another half hour. I now have service again, but I will be waiting to see what comes next. In the fine print, ATT can change terms at any time, without notice. I have never had a good experience with ATT and I do not trust the company. The terms are very long and complex (yes, I try to read the fine print).
try calling customer service wait hours then they hang up. dont dare ask to lower bill they said yes my next bill was double then took for ever to fix it.use anyone else they are horrible.

Could not get high speed saleman off my property going door to door. Call AT and T and they told me if he came back call police. He came back next day and police had to come to get him gone for good. Why would a company tell me to call police on one of there employees, they should of told him to leave and not to go back to this home. We have no trespassing signs up.

We have AT&t fiber optics home internet. We have thoroughly enjoyed our internet services and the people who came out to install it were very helpful and kind. I logged on to view our bill and saw a deal for a new phone. Because we had such good success with our home internet we decided to switch our phone carriers, get two new phones on AT&t, and bundle our services to save us some money. We called customer service to have all of our questions answered and the man was very helpful. After answering all of our questions he asked us if we were ready to switch over and we said yes. He told us everything we needed to know about the deal and how it would all work out. He then took down all of our information on our previous phone that we were to trade in for this deal. He told us that since we were doing it over the phone he would put us in for a kit so that we could send our phones back in the mail. This was ideal for us as we have a new baby. After we completed our phone order we received our phones in the mail a few days later. We got everything actived, set up and switched over just fine. When our first bill came around it was exactly what he had told us it would be on the phone. We got our first bill after 15 days of service. I called customer service back because we still hadn't received our kit to mail our phones in to AT&t. The lady on the line said that they had sent them out and we just needed to wait and that they should be in our mailbox within the next couple days. After a couple of days still not had received the kit so I called AT&t back. This time the man on the phone said that the deal had expired and we were no longer eligible for it. I did not understand how this could be possible as we were still within our 30 day activation time. He was very unhelpful and very rude. The next day I called customer service again and spoke to another man. He told me that there was no order in the system for us. There was no order for our brand new phones and there was no order for the mailing kits so that we could send in our new phones. I asked him how this was possible as I had two new phones and I was now paying monthly credits for two new phones. After spending about an hour and a half on the phone with him and he was supposedly digging around our account trying to find out what was going on he told me he was sorry but there was nothing he could do because there was no record of anything. I went to our email account to try and find the order email and it is no longer available and I can no longer access any information about our order through the online app or by going through the desktop online. On my next day off of work I went into the AT&t store and spoke to the manager and explain to him all of this. He said that this was a very common issue that AT&t was dealing with when it came to processing online and phone orders. He said he was sorry but there was nothing he could do for us and we were just going to have to pay for the phones. I told him this was not acceptable and that they needed to figure out a way to rectify this situation because I did not switch to AT&t to buy two brand new phones. I could have done that with my old phone company. I am now in the process of trying to go back and speak to a different manager and if nobody can help me and they're sorry and we are just out of luck then I guess I'm going to have to give them their phone back and switch back to my old carrier. I never had any issues like this with my old carrier. Sticking with AT&t to save 20 bucks a month is not worth going through all of this. This has been a very stressful and disappointing event. We have a new baby and we were not expecting to have to pay for two brand new phones. While an extra $60 a month may not be much to some it is a lot for us. I was so looking forward to having the same great experience as we did with our internet. I'm so saddened by the lack of disregard and unhelpfulness I have received in this matter.
On hold waiting to speak to a representative about voicemail issues for over an hour. Finally hung up!! Was told expected wait time would be 20 minutes.  Guess you were a tad off!! DO BETTER!!!!!

If I could give a -5 star I would. This company has the worst customer service I have ever dealt with. Hung up on my call, didn't call back when the robot said they would. AT&T would not. there is not one good reason for them to keep our old numbers. My number was also completely cleaned up, no robo calls, no spam!, and now I have to start all over! All the major carriers have sub carriers & they all use the same cell towers. Save yourself the money and down the road aggravation.

On April 17, 2024 Geraldine Walsh went to the AT&T store at 10 Washington Street, Norwell, MA to get a new phone.  She gave her iPhone 12 PRO to the store manager as a trade-in for a new phone.  The amount for the iPhone (trade-in) was going to be $750 as quoted by the manager.  He did not give her a receipt as he said the credit would show up as a credit in her online bill.  When after 2 months Geraldine did not see the credit, she called the store.  That manager is now at a new store.  The current manager told her there was no "record" of her iPhone 12 Pro being given to the previous store manager as a trade-in.  She then called AT& T multiple times - and they also told her there was no record of her trading in her phone.  They did nothing to help.  Finally, "Missy" from AT &T said that it was up to Geraldine to prove that she gave the manager her phone and that she should file a police report. Geraldine has now filed a police report, and they are going to pull the stores camera.  That AT&T was so completely unhelpful is so awful.

If I could give 0 stars, I would. I have been a loyal customer for decades. I had the UVerse bundle and called customer service because I was having computer disconnect, TV streaming would freeze and you would get kicked off of your tablet or phone multiple times daily. The AT&T customer service person told me he was going to get me set up with Spectrum because in my area AT&T cannot offer the bandwidth/speed I need for multiple people & devices. I asked the agent if I called AT&T or Spectrum and he said AT&T. So in Jan 24 I received the Spectrum router & modem. In Feb 24 I set up the spectrum account totally remotely and then sent the AT&T equipment back via UPS. I didn’t think anything of it and recently looked through my bank statement and found I have been getting charged $71/month from AT&T. Elsa, the supervisor I eventually spoke with because I felt they should refund every penny they have been taking since I returned their equipment told me:1. You didn’t call to disconnect service (what the hell is the return of equipment??? A continuation??)2. There is no way I could have had Spectrum set up remotely from my home, I would have had to have a Spectrum service person at my house….bullcrap, I still have the remote set up instructions they sent with the equipment next to my spectrum router.3. Even though they take the money directly from my checking account, they will send me a 1 month refund on a prepaid Visa….hmmmm, you had no problem taking it out, but you don’t wanna put it back4. And yeah, a 1 month refund because I didn’t ‘call to disconnect.’ I also didn’t call to get a Spectrum account, it was their employee who recommended it…. Sent back their freaking equipment and if they interrogate my wifi, they can see I have not used it in months. Just wanted service without so many disruptions.So dissatisfied on so many levels. I’m looking to change my cellphone service provider and I will never go back. AT&T stinks and they are not good faith actors.

I have had an incredibly frustrating experience with my current cell phone provider. First, the sales representative misled me by saying that if I got two iPhone 14 Pro Maxes, I would get two additional iPhones for free for my kids. I was also switching from a different provider, and he assured me that my bill would only be $165. When I asked about settling my bill with the previous provider, he said not to worry and that they would handle it.For the first three months, everything seemed fine. However, I eventually noticed my bill had increased to $220. When I called customer service, they informed me that the previous lower amount was part of a promotion and that my regular payments for the Pro Max were now due. I begrudgingly accepted this.The situation worsened when I needed to travel. I inquired about unlocking my phone to receive business calls abroad and was told it would cost $10 per day. Despite paying this fee, the service was terrible and I continued to be charged.Two days ago, I received a call from a collections agency regarding an unpaid balance for the phones from my previous provider. I was under the impression that AT&T had taken care of this, but they explained how it actually works.I went online and noticed that I am being charged for 4 phones. When I called customer service, they informed me that they would only give me a $6 credit for each phone they received from us as a trade-in. Now, not only do I have to pay my previous cell provider $1,300, but I am also essentially paying for the phones all over again without any clear explanation from AT&T.

I am utterly disappointed with AT&T and regret choosing them as my service provider. The service has been nothing short of a hassle, largely due to their misleading advertisements and hidden fees. Initially, the plan seemed reasonably priced, but soon after, I noticed unexpected charges creeping onto my bill. These fees were never mentioned during the sales process, and every attempt to resolve this confusion with customer service led to more frustration due to their lack of clarity and assistance.Moreover, their lock-in plan has been a major inconvenience, especially as someone who travels frequently. I was shocked to discover that unlocking my phone for international use required an additional payment of $1000 to switch to an international e-SIM. This policy was neither clearly communicated at the outset nor does it seem reasonable or customer-friendly.Overall, AT&T’s approach feels deceitful and customer-unfriendly, focusing more on trapping consumers with hidden costs rather than providing transparent and reliable service. I cannot recommend AT&T to anyone, and I advise potential customers to consider other providers who value customer satisfaction and transparency.

Aside from the rising costs over the years, the extreme “legalese” in superfine print no one has time to read when time to replace an aging phone, as well as the questionable practices regarding the AT&T insurance and submitting claims, and sales reps that may need additional training in communications, dealing with call centers that may not have clear insight on local issues – my recent issue begins with the mistake of upgrading to a Samsung Fold Z4 shortly after it became available.While the phone was impressive in terms of the screen size, it came with many more “unknown” cons I would learn about the hard way, than pro’s. Although Samsung boasts waterproof/resistant, it is not dustproof. Amazing that a speck of dust can create havoc on the screen rendering it unreadable at a significant pace and hence I had to replace it after 7(?) months or so…while I had insurance on all my devices had to shell out another 700.00+ to get the replacement. Ok, lesson learned, be sure to create a good seal around the folding part.In May of 2024  (with another 18 months of installment payments left), Wi-Fi and Bluetooth stopped working entirely and despite many attempts and online research to fix on my own, had no other choice but to get a replacement phone. I  did not want to deal with a claim at the time due to the frustration of already having to replace again and of course work and life. Went back to the AT&T store and explained the situation and wound up with a new phone and a new business line I did not need, it was not clear to me that although I brought the old phone in  at the time that I would be  stuck with paying installments on both. Again, I was not paying attention as the frustration just grew – especially after there happened to be a Samsung rep in the store and when the sales person asked him if it was common that the Wi-Fi and Bluetooth would stop working and he shook his head rather non-chalantly and that is when I popped up and advised that is not what I discovered in various online sites – Samsung for one - regarding a known issue with the fold.Once I discovered I am still paying for the Fold, I called AT&T and an hour of wasted effort, I was referred to the claim site and here is where it gets really interesting. The Fold no longer showed up as a registered device so I could not file a claim… AT&T rep on the phone had me register the phone with my true number associated and I asked if that was going to impact my current working phone and basically had me attempt to claim on both phones… I can’t make this stuff up folks, simply unreal. I then went back to the store to see if the claim can be done from there and was told of course they could help. Only issue is the phone had been turned off for a bit so now it was not showing up on the network and when I asked how to do that as the phone did not work… no Wi-Fi – the salesperson asked her co-worker and he would not even respond to me which is ok, but stated to put a sim in the phone and make a few calls, etc…Went home and tried it and guess what? Still not showing up on network and now the screen appears to be damaged again… and growing. At this point, not sure if it is worth my peace to deal with this and just eat the cost. Moral of the story is check everything including the fine print, question all policies, particularly the insurance policies and whatever deductibles you are responsible for, and have a backup plan. My plan involves fulfilling my debt obligations on these phones and once they are paid for, removing all services I have with AT&T after many years as my provider and never doing business with AT&T again…Hope this helps in some way.

Dear AT&T,I am deeply concerned about the recent data breach affecting your network. The reported loss of up to 6 months of call and text message data for all customers is alarming. This incident raises serious questions about your data protection practices and network security measures.Data Collection Concerns:Why is it necessary to collect and store Social Security Numbers (SSNs)?What is the justification for retaining such extensive communication records?Security Vulnerabilities:How was it possible for such a vast amount of data to be exfiltrated without detection?What failings in your monitoring systems allowed this breach to occur?Future Prevention:What specific steps will you take to prevent similar incidents in the future?How do you plan to enhance your network monitoring capabilities to detect unusual data movements or potential breaches?Customer Protection:What measures are you implementing to protect customers whose data has been compromised?How will you ensure transparency in your data handling practices moving forward?As a customer, I am disappointed that my personal data may now be in unauthorized hands. I urge you to take immediate and concrete actions to:Improve your network security infrastructureImplement more robust monitoring systemsEnhance your incident response capabilitiesReview and justify your data retention policiesYour response to this incident will be crucial in rebuilding customer trust. I look forward to hearing about the specific steps you will take to address these critical issues and prevent future breaches.

Being robbed for not speaking English, I already had an internet plan in my apartment with At&t, I paid $60 and my 2 phone lines were from Mint Mobile and I paid $90 per month.I was receiving AT&T advertising at my house. Horrible Experience with AT&T Cell Phone Service - Beware!I am writing this review to share my extremely negative experience with AT&T cell phone service in hopes of warning others before they make the same mistake I did. If this review saves at least one person, then it has done its job.From the very beginning, expectations regarding billing were not communicated clearly. This left me with a false sense of what I would be billed. Imagine my shock when the bill, which was supposed to be consistent, changed so much that it ended up being approximately $50 more per month than what I was initially told.The nightmare doesn't end there. Trying to reach the third-party seller that sold us the service at Target was extremely difficult. Their lack of availability and support added to my frustration. Even the local AT&T store admitted that the third-party seller did us dirty, confirming our fears that we were misled from the start.When I turned to AT&T customer service for help, they were anything but helpful. All they did was reduce our plan to something equivalent to the prepaid plan we had moved from, which was Boost Mobile. For the record, Boost Mobile had way better cost and service.This is a warning to anyone considering AT&T: Be sure you get any and all promises clearly stated, both verbally and in writing. Do not sign anything you haven't thoroughly read and understood. Ask them to explain it 20 times if you need to, but definitely get what your final bill will be IN WRITING.Our experience with AT&T has been horrible, and I will never use their services again. To make matters worse, we are now stuck with them for three years unless we pay a ridiculous amount to get out of the contract. Even our expectations regarding canceling services were incorrect; we were completely misinformed about what we could do if we wanted to cancel.Now we are stuck, feeling deceived and frustrated. I hope this review serves as a cautionary tale for anyone considering AT&T. If it can prevent just one person from going through what we did, it will have served its purpose. Do yourself a favor and steer clear of AT&T.

You can't get your phone back, owe no. You donate that to AT&T. But if I move to another carrier I owe AT&T $555.46. Scam(maybe, I definely feel like I've been scammed)?? Deceptive...DEFINITELY!

I was ready to switch to Spectrum which I will soon if it wasn't for DirectTV steam which only offer to ATT&T.  But, my anger and frustration still exist with this company, I will soon switch and my friends and family will know exactly what my experience is and how I feel about AT&T.AT&T needs to train their support team in every aspect of figuring out what the issue is. I wish I could give them zero stars. My bill changes every month. Don't bother, they will quote you a good price, tell you you are getting great promotions, tell you it takes months to show up on your account, then the promotions will never show up and you will finish out your contract paying 50-100 dollars more than they quoted. They will do nothing about it.

My experience with AT&T has been extremely disappointing. My internet went down early Monday morning, and despite multiple calls to customer service, the earliest technician appointment I was given is on Friday. This prolonged outage has caused significant disruptions to my work. Additionally, communication from AT&T has been lacking, with no updates or proactive outreach to inform me of the status of the repair. I expected better service and support, especially considering the impact on my ability to work from home. AT&T needs to improve their response times and customer communication.
